message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about cetaceans, which are mammals with blowholes, such as dolphins and whales. These animals use echolocation to navigate and communicate with each other. They emit clicks and listen for the echoes to determine the location of objects and other individuals. Therefore, the correct answer is option (D) - clicks. Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because blowhole signals are not related to radio waves or air horns. Option (C) is also incorrect because blowholes are not used for hearing human speech.

This question requires basic knowledge about mammals with blow holes, such as dolphins and whales. These mammals are able to emit and receive sound signals through their blow holes. These signals, known as clicks, are used for communication and echolocation. Option (A) is incorrect because radio waves are not a form of communication for mammals with blow holes. Option (B) is incorrect because air horns are not related to the communication abilities of these mammals. Option (C) is incorrect because while they may be able to hear people talking if they are close enough, this is not specific to their ability to hear signals.

Option (B) is incorrect because air horns are human-made signals and not natural signals. Option (C) is incorrect because while these mammals may be able to perceive the vibrations of people talking, they primarily rely on clicks for communication and navigation.
